Definitions.Meaning: a suffix added to words to indicate that they are trash, litter, or messy.
to give something of emotional, spiritual or intellectual value (as opposed to giving something of tangible/physical value)
comfort; particular, the sense that you are doing the right thing, and fit where you belong, and know how to behave in any given situation

Meaning: to name (in the sense of defining something by naming it)
false collar; (literally 'summer shoulder yoke'). Any convenience item meant to go under robes to look like you're wearing more of them.
to stay, in the sense of 'ceasing to travel/deciding to stop moving' sense.
for show, or not in earnest.
to make sparks because of friction. Originally literal, now usually figurative.
the feelings that arise in response to gaul; the tearing grief and guilt and paralysis of knowing that the fulfillment of one duty causes one to fail in another.
blood payment; an antiquated legal term from history, when qet required people to have honor prices.
bead of blood'. This is an old term infrequently seen outside of poetry or historical contexts. Most commonly seen in modern use as the name of a plant with small red berries.
responsibility; stewardship; care; maintenance; the out-breath of the universe. That which maintains the world, and which maintains everything else. The sacred foundation of all things.
all; antiquated word for 'all members' or 'gestalt' or 'everything that can be counted as part of this' or 'sum total'. Now unused, except as prefix or infix for words
measure; this is used currently solely to refer to the historical role

Etymology.roots: When Old Ai-Naidari word 'jael' met Language A, the 'j' sound in promise became the 'jz' sound when the prefix was added.

Meaning: scrap-skirt; a piece of clothing worn by adolescents who have graduated out of basic over-the-head gowns, made of several panels of scrap fabric sewn together at the waist. The adolescent usually gets to choose the scraps, and may switch out panels when the mood strikes them; a way of nodding to the adolescent need for novelty.
lost; infrequently meant in the literal sense (as in being lost in a city), ainan usually refers to a mental state where one cannot get one's bearings.
authority (social, specific to those above the Wall of Birth)
to assert authority (specifically, that of those above the Wall of Birth)
remit; the area of authority or responsibility of a specific individual or group.

value; only applies to people. In this case, a person's worth, as measured by the things important to Ai-Naidar: the size of their family, their contribution to society and how well they fulfill their ishas.
safety, particularly moral or constructed safety (that created and enforced by people)
moral duty to influence the universe toward good.
to embody, to make a virtue or divinity flesh
touch (specifically, intimate, though not necessarily sexual)
touch-embellish; a rite by which the ribbons are adjusted by a lord, subsequent to the merethek

touch-lover; beloved; someone allowed to touch your entire body in a non-sexual context at any time and in any situation or company--this word requires it be mutual on each other's parts. This blanket permission is rarely given and always a special intimacy.
the local destruction of an individual's community, caused by their inability or unwillingness to accept aid, love or form connections.
bloodline love, 'maternal instinct' (but applies more broadly).
to discover/know by consulting others or observing natural phenomenon.
soul-twin (someone who is so much like you that you reinforce each other).
answer / reply (this older word takes a different ending for the verb)
to force above its natural state.
ugh'. Indicates frustration/disgust. Nasalized 'ah' sound... wrinkle your nose and pull your lips back from your teeth to say it.

touch-allowed; someone who is permitted to touch more of you than caste-rank law requires, but who cannot touch all of you; this is not necessarily mutual, and it can have rather careful rules describing its boundaries.

touch-allowed-mutual; someone who is permitted to touch more of you than caste-rank law requires, but who cannot touch all of you, a state that often has rather careful rules describing its boundaries. This is, however, a mutual condition.
happy; not a state, but a moment.

bring out of malleable-space; the people allowed to do this are rare, and this almost always refers to the part of Correction that involves easing a person out of the state where they were receptive to Correction and into the state of once again being a normal member of society; this requires the facilitation and guidance of someone else.
to twine, to wind (as a vine does when growing)
student; particuarly, the kind of person who sits back and listens hard, and is typically quietly and attentively focusing on what they're learning.
student; any age; indicates a fundamental drive and passion for learning beyond the necessary fundamentals.

a person who is capable of reaching out to someone who is too broken to respond appropriately. The quality of being capable of this is called geten and is one of the rarer forms of esar (quality that makes one fit to lead).
beauty (applies to a person, and speaks of inner beauty that transforms the body/shell in the eyes of its viewers).
lovers - a more specific form of this word, means someone with whom you are lovers, and this activity has made them part of your family.
lovers - a more specific form of this word, means someone with whom you are lovers, and who is not part of your family.
someone who works harmoniously with another, complementing their strengths and compensating for their weaknesses.
master of a skill/trade/ability/etc; this word can also mean 'authority' when the authority in question is a master of their craft or skill, or a learned person.
a person who sets a good example (singular is ashovreni)
someone with unusual wholeness/integrity. Someone of moral fiber even in the face of extremis (see also quvil)
compassion in the face of weakness.
arteries, specifically the large ones near the heart.
emotional polluter. Someone who vents their negativity without caring how it affects others. A personality that requires Correction.

Etymology.roots: Uses the "ash-" formation for making people words

Meaning: to live (where life is something given to you, divine, as a gift you receive, or a duty you must do)
balance of a life (how many years you have between now and whenever you die)
to live (where you are making your life, day by day, as a conscious act of creation)
to live (where you are earning your life)
raison d'etre; reason for being, for existing. Sometimes incorrectly translated as destiny.
to heart-break (got mashed together from 'great heart' and 'to wound')
area of responsibility, literally "rays" for the wedge shape atani are usually divided into.
emotional outlets; anything that allows a person to relieve emotional stress in a safe, healthy and socially acceptable way.

blood; this is a weird word, in that the plural refers to blood outside the body (no matter how many bodies it came from), while the irregular singular, auhhein, refers to blood in the body, one particular body.
demon; lurker; blood-shadow; a monster that draws the life and blood out of people at night or in shadows. Was literal, has become a figurative description of depression.
the uncomfortable silence/awkwardness after a social bomb

1. a color--emerald green, very lush and deep, with a slight tint of blue. 2. anything or anyone alien, from people and worlds to emotions and thoughts (though more rarely used for the latter). sing. aunerai.

furless; some Ai-Naidar are born with no fur (usually on their ventrals, particularly the chest and throat or face); in rare cases, with no fur at all. This is considered exotic and somewhat unseemly.
nude, without clothing; has a connotation of "stripped" (as in, to the essential and atomic).
implacable (in the gradient of abased - neutral - implacable); note this word is almost pronounced 'aure' but the final vowel isn't purposely voiced
letters (like the ones that make up words)
despite (only used in the English-archaic sense of 'in despite')
as an affix, describes anything that spreads via contact; derived from the word for panic, which the Ai-Naidar characterize as the kind of hysterical fear that spreads quickly.
without compare - never refers to people

"you are what you (must) do" - a concept word, blended from separate words. Dates back to the shift from civilization being based on propriety to being based on love. Means that what you are, and who you are, is incidental compared to what you do, and that you should do as duty requires.
incise wounds while applying the dye. This ritual often cripples, and sometimes kills, those it is bestowed upon. Only Thirukedi is permitted to bestow such marks.
to mate (if referring to animals); to rape, between people. Also used as a noun
pandemic (a disease that affects more than one world)
non-verbal communication between two people who are close.
to communicate non-verbally with one with whom one is intimate.

to make food nourishing. Implies cooking, but not necessarily; raw food that is made nourishing (by the addition of sauces, or by preparing it to make it more easily digested) is also said to have been bashen.
person who makes food nourishing. Cook. Chef.
headshatter - when someone explodes all your thoughts with some concept
someone with a constipated head (too full of thoughts to think clearly).
sash. This is a broad belt of fabric, sometimes stiff, sometimes soft.
a pause that allows people to compose themselves
harvest (can also be used as a verb)
to figure out what you really mean/think by talking through it to someone else.
then (conditional, not time: so "IF I do this, THEN I will do this" not "do it then (later)"

outlets; appropriate, safe and healthy ways for non-Ai-Naidar to release stress. This can be emotional stress (as in animals), or it can be mechanical (as in machines). Note that systems, such as societies, do not use this word; they use atse, the word for a thinking person's emotional outlets.
squire (the assistant to a senior guardian, who maintains his equipment)
soft (said of fur and hair of people)
syringe (literally: blood straw). Singular is beshelauhheni.
body lotions, things that make skin and pelt soft/smooth
leadership quality (rare form of esar), which allows a person to see a flaw in a person, understand its wellspring, and know implicitly how to Correct it to make that person whole.
the inability to form deep attachments to those who are capable of returning one's feelings.

ambition: defined among Ai-Naidar as a desire to be superior to others by accruing more wealth, achievement, power or fame than is appropriate for a person of one's caste and rank. Considered a sickness that requires Correction.
to goof off (to play, but for adults; not negative, necessarily, so long as it's kept within limits). Noun form is ridiculous 'bokiboki'
to be defensive, to bite someone because you're in pain or scared
be contained in (part of). Roughly analogous to 'of'.
Solar day. Distinct based on season and world.

sound effect made when someone takes a blow that could have been avoided/teaches them not to knock their heads. This word might be scrawled alongside a picture of a teacher smacking a student on the side of the head.
feeling you get when someone gives you something that you didn't want at all (the thing that makes you say 'thanks I hate it') Verb form is used in the same way 'hate' is ("I hate it").
all right (not as in 'I am all right' but as in 'all right already!' )
way (as in manner, not as in route)
to attempt - more formal than tiriv (to try), and most often used with more serious subjects.
seizure (as in of property or possessions, not the medical condition)
music pieces - small chunks of melody used to build common songs
weeds (also used as slang for someone who's always popping up underfoot)
people who are always underfoot (also, clumsy people)
a person who is always underfoot on purpose, who never leaves you alone
lightnings; the singular needs to be formed poetically ("a finger of lightning" or "a touch of lightning")
milk (singular form of this noun refers to a single serving of milk; plural, to milk as a whole/concept)

the ability to transform, reframe, or build good and beauty out of adversity, tragedy, or wreckage; a good quality for common people, and an esar quality highly prized in leaders who have to work in dangerous areas
well, as applied to people's mental state ('are you okay')
sorry (for your loss, that you're in pain, that something happened)
family; those related to an individual or under his/her protection as a family (important: this includes chosen-family as well as blood-family).
family time, an hour or so where people sit together and work, play a game, or do other activities together.
slang: food that is prepared so that it's easy to share
an element added to a well-functioning community or society that creates disharmony
the ability to be interchangable in most of your relationships so long as you have a single relationship in which you are special/unique.
people who are related to you by blood/genetics.

"What is repented of is forgiven." Since the public condemnation of wrong-doing is one of the duties of the Ai-Naidar, it is not uncommon for people's misdemeanors to be aired in public. It is essential that those who are so seen are assumed to have paid their debts, repented and are "clean" again. This interjection is an expression of that forgiveness.

intended flaw; something placed in a work (or allowed to exist in a work with correction) both as proof that it was created by hand, and to give those who can't rest until they've found a flaw something to notice so they can relax.
channel (can be used in the first declension to denote a person who is a channel for things beyond themselves)
face, social face; the way you talk and act around particular people, which is expected to be different depending on who you're interacting with.
to sneak around/try not to draw attention to yourself after you've upset someone--almost invariably used of children who've just received a scolding
to part from/separate (as in separating dough, fabric, etc from its greater body)
parted soul; twin from another body; two people who are believed to be incomplete without the other. An ancient concept.
squabble. A fight that has nothing to do with the topic; the topic is an excuse to let the participants blow off steam caused by small relationship incompatibilities or day to day stresses.
kitchen; place where food is prepared.
lurker; a social word. Someone who never participates in a community, nor gives to it, but takes from it when needed. Very bad.
to have one's concentration interrupted when one is trying to focus on something that requires a great deal of time.
to stand watch; note that this also forms the root of one of the Guardian caste-ranks, originally used for Ai-Naidar who kept watch over the sea approaches.
to carry on (as in tradition, through generations)
clutter, refering specifically and without separation to both the spiritual and physical Sorts.
clutter, emotional; the emotional haze caused by having many unSorted/unexamined feelings.
play-fight/mock-fight; banter. Can be verbal or physical.
to act, in particular to act in a way that is comical or mischievous.
to family-kiss (also a noun, a family-kiss). This is a kiss intended to express affection or chaste love, not one intended to arouse.
festival desserts made from compacted rice

mentor; one who can no longer perform all the duties of his/her caste-rank and is now primarily engaged in aiding others to perfect their own understanding of their duties. Often a role that falls to the elderly or disabled, but can sometimes land on one who is very good at teaching. (sing. diqedi)
the science/study of perpetuating healthy communities

herbal compound commonly given to males who want children but are having physical issues performing the act that begets them. Has also come to mean any physically unpleasant or difficult duty that has desirable results.
to terrorize - this term is specific to physical fears
terror - this term is specific to physical fears
holes of silence - a pause in a conversation between subjects.
black: specifically the black of holes, or voids.

affected, acted upon. One says this of people who have reacted to something. Note this is a term not bound by time: it refers to an effect that exists and has for some time and probably will continue to. So one might speak of a childhood experience, and say that a person has been affected by it, or shaped by it.
the backs of the hands (the protected part)

the surprise when you misread someone and unfortunate things happen. (For example, if someone is giving off 'I'm angry' signals and you miss them and that makes them abruptly cut off all contact with you.)
'place mind'. The belief that the physical environment you're in shapes your thoughts.
become / be shaped by (in the sense that a potter would shape clay)
to shape/be shaped by agitation/lack of clarity
worth, in this case, very basic 'does this deserve to exist' worth. (In modern usage, only applies to objects; historically was also applied to people)
heavy (as in weight, the opposite of light)
spokes (used both for small things like wheels, and large things like the divisions between city districts)
to serve as something that molds other things. Can be literal or figurative (to set an example for)
presence (and the ability to control it). This is a form of esar
walls, exterior (on any kind of building)
the vulnerable side, the front (can be conjugated to form a verb: 'turn to the front')

administrator; specifically, an assistant or planner or scheduler or administrator who is so on top of things they seem to be everywhere at once, and yet never seem ruffled. This word used to mean "asset" and has since migrated to mean, specifically, someone who is one.
hothouse flower - a flower that is delicate or finicky, and dies without the exact right conditions
ocean (note: the word 'dore', to boil, formed from this word because boiling water looks like the froth of the sea)
just (as in 'exactly or precisely,' not as in 'just a moment ago')

ejecta; vomit. Originally a medical term describing something ejected via force from the body, now generalized for any kind of rejected thing, so long as it is violently flung. It is often used by Guardians to describe shrapnel, for instance. It is never used to describe a part of the object in question, however; the sun's ejecta when it flings off some of its volume is not ehenej, because the ejecta was originally part of the sun.

story (this is a plural noun with no singular). When Ai-Naidar wish to refer to a discrete story, they use the word for its type (as we would use "novel" for a fictional work of a specific size and intention, rather than, say, a "parable").
acceptance-happiness; the feeling of pleasure one derives from helping those around you when you have the right help to give and they have the right need you can fulfill.

"benefit of the doubt." Your willingness to believe that people who do things differently (or believe things you think are stupid, wrong or dangerous), are not bad people who want to destroy you, but that they have some reasonable cause for their actions/thoughts.
vital spark, the different thing that inspires or gives life to something otherwise stable or stagnant or sterile

trust; specifically the trust that develops when an authority has power and does not abuse it. This trust is largely responsible for society working, and is not possible if those in power are forbidden every excess or wrongful use of their power.
a fight caused by big, existing emotional problems between two people

perspective; the ability to see oneself in the context of everything else. The cultivation of perspective is considered a necessary requirement for contentment, empathy and healthy, normal behaviors, and many soul-sicknesses are said to be the result of a failure of perspective.

chain; biological concept, of self as part of a long, unbroken line of blood family, from ancestors to children. Has connotations of eternity and immortality, but without the strong sense of individual persistence.
as'. Used as standalone comparative for emphasis.'
to let someone go; to let them grow up; to let them take care of themselves. Most often used in a parental context, but not limited to that relationship.
to guard (related to the root for the current word for the Guardian caste-rank that guards the Emperor, the nakked)
ribbons. Can be literal, also applies to the patterns drawn on Ai-Naidar during the merethek by their lords and ladies.
clean, presentable, groomed, dressed. Applies only to people.
to see obliquely; to look at something and see not what is obvious to others. A necessary quality for an Exception, but also useful in others who need to solve problems.
thorough; derived from 'enil', to see obliquely, to see things not obvious to others.

emotional/social vulnerability: refers to the likelihood of someone being healthy in society based on how well they are emotionally and socially supported. *used* to refer to the health of someone's reputation, but the meaning has migrated as the noble/regal classes went from aristocrat landholders to administrators.
just (as in 'a moment ago', not as in 'precisely or exactly')
to aim for the same destination

the quality that makes one a superb leader; this is a sublime thing composed of your character, your actions, your social position (rank and caste), your upbringing. There are many different kinds of esar.
to kiss another when their mouth tastes of your body fluids.

condition by which none of the rules apply; this is often referred to in stories where both the rules of rank and caste and the Book of Exceptions have no power over the behavior of a person. There is both an element of fright and fascination with the ethek.
free; unfettered by society; the adjective form of ethek, describing a person or situation where no rules apply
calligraphy (singular refers to a piece of calligraphy)

to assign blame and innocence to the proper parties; to correctly place people in the roles of victim, perpetrator, bystander and abettor. A legal term referring to a duty of priests, Guardians and those serving as judges.

guilt, improper; used only when a person feels guilt for a situation for which they are not responsible. Sometimes incorrectly translated "survivor's guilt", but is more broadly applicable to any instance where a person takes on guilt for something undeserving.
eyelashes. Irregular singular faelni does not refer to one eyelash, but to all the lashes of a single eye. A single lash when it falls is known as a gevani elet, "eye-hair."
twenty (also the word for 'an armful, a plentitude)
to encourage someone with attention, playfully
blame, wrong-doing; this used to be the proper noun form of 'faid' the verb 'to blame', but it fell out of use in normal speech and is now reserved only for formal occasions.
feelings; sensations; applies only to tactile or physical feelings
long context - the 'history' you develop with people through shared experiences, references, and conversations
to leave in its natural state.
to document biographically (in the modern vernacular). It can still be found in older documents being used to mean 'to know' (intimately).

biography; description of people's personal life/circumstances, as in a CV or formal report; this word used to mean 'intimacy' or 'intimate knowledge' but gravitated toward a formal/legal definition while two modern words split off to better describe degrees of intimacy.
demonstrative in showing affection, the opposite of uvren.
wet napkin, used during meal to keep fingers clean
dry napkin, used after meal to finish tidying yourself
Decoration, an Ai-Naidar social caste; can refer to the caste itself or the individual fathriked within the caste. (sing. fathrikedi)
mantle (usually used metaphorically to express a duty that carries with it power and responsibility, often divine or of great social importance)
compassion (in leaders, an esar quality). Also used as a given name.
compassion (in leaders, an esar quality); in particular, the compassion earned through undergoing difficult learning experiences, and being humbled.
caterwauling, in particular, yelling in a house to summon someone (presumably because you are too lazy to get up and find them yourself.)
atmosphere, physical (specifically, the environment and the objects in it that have been arranged by a people)

Etymology.roots: Formed out of 'fenijz' smashing into 'met' (the word for body)

Meaning: fur (not interchangeable with hair, a different word). Ai-Naidari fur is very short and very fine, more like felt or velveteen than animal fur. Singular fenzani refers to a pelt (on or off a person), not to a single hair.
Tease-freedom, tease-license. when someone is allowed to tease someone, then they have tease-license. Otherwise, it’s considered rude to tease someone beyond a certain amount.
bounty (as in crops, not as in money for bringing in criminals)
knowledge too great to bear, hurtful to know, that causes sickness
to be broken by the inappropriate acquisition of knowledge; to have your ignorance taken away from you in such a way that it damages you.
beautiful, lovely (said of things, not people)
need to follow, be subordinate, serve one particular person, be receptive/submissive, be given clear direction (one side of the scale of ieqera).

any small thing used to scent a space: incense, essential oils, potpourri, etc. Does not apply to perfume, except in derogatory terms (i.e. saying "he was wearing so much cologne he could have perfumed a temple"). Different kinds of fil are made clear by appending other words. Also used figuratively referring to fil ekain, or "incense stories", short tales which linger long after they have ended.
incense, specifically, the stick or cone kind
to ghost; for them, means 'to give good advice with which you can't argue, in a kind of nosy way'
ghosts (literally 'incense people'). Has a more positive and specific connotation for Ai-Naidar, who still think of the dead and passed as present in their lives.
a cover for something that it is inappropriate to look at. Most commonly used for guns.
to go with purpose/ to travel
to tidy, to put in order

dexterity, ability to balance; usually refers to physical balance (like the ability to walk a tight-wire); in leaders, used figuratively to indicate an ability to walk fine lines between difficult needs or problems, and is a form of esar
raw, tender, abraded. Used mostly in the emotional sense: when you're so bruised up that everything bothers, upsets, or tips you over an edge.
to imperfectly place; to have someone not quite fit where they are, but not yet in a disastrous way.
sweet (said of scents, and also actions)
boundaries; always physical--this older word one meant the boundaries of a territory held by a specific ruler, and is used in legal texts, and in architecture.
vocal, speech-making, the opposite of silent/mute
anyway (in the sense of 'would have happened in any case, or nonetheless, or regardless). Not used to return conversations to their original topics (see 'vaeshan').
a digestive/stimulant herb used as a palate cleanser. Flavor like... mint or pepper (or both); is both piquant and refreshing.
black, the black of the world, of night skies, of caves, etc.
the feeling one feels toward a person who continually pushes one away, usually described as a combination of antipathy and exhaustion.
rejected; specifically, when one offers a loved one necessary help but is refused, resulting in the loved one limping onward in poor state out of stubbornness.
the need for singularity, for unique circumstances.
placed where one belongs; particularly, where their talent is so specific it has to be passed somewhere else, possibly disordering their social situation.
emotional violence, passion, deep emotion, aggression
torture; specifically "suffering or pain without purpose or result." If declined, forms the noun. If conjugated, forms the verb.
to annoy, to cause someone to be focused wrongly
a situation in which duties conflict among Ai-Naidar.
to be focused on the wrong thing; to be using the wrong lens through which to see something, causing all your assumptions/conclusions about it to be incorrect.
to move on; was once literally 'to walk away from' but is more often used now in an emotional context
to eat without rushing, for pleasure, in company.
"tight scrolls". Someone who has it together.
"scroll hands." Someone with a delicate touch, literally and/or emotionally. (Someone whose hands doesn't damage scrolls when using/reading).
"loose scrolls." Someone scattered, disorganized, unable to think clearly.
tunic (can refer to either Merchant or Guardian version).
neutral (in the gradient of abased - neutral - implacable)
contrasting note; that which, against a backdrop of similar feelings, items or things offers a distinct counter without which one would lose the appreciation of that which one is experiencing.
cream, soft/pale cream color, yellowish in tint
sing. gelme sherani), the humble plant, the host plant forlet arva, the tea vine.
the quality (or Qualities), act(s) and/or thought(s) that form the foundation of positive relationship.

the ability to reach out to someone who is too broken to respond appropriately. This is considered one of the rarer forms of esar (in that if it not often necessary). A person with this quality is known as an ashgeten.
branches; originally used to refer to the father's side of the family, now used for literal branches.
hair, as in the hair on one's head. Also refers to the hair that grows at the end of the tail, and to the tufts at the end of one's ear.
the tuft of hair on the end of the tail
one long hair; genealogists wear this single long hair as a symbol of their profession. Literally (more or less) "hair chain," (as in the biological chain of generations).
glimmer; the shards of colored light cast by stained glass or painted paper when light passes through it. Colloquially used to refer to bits of happiness cast by a single source.

glimmery; said of something that sheds colored light, like a mirrored ball, stained glass window or painted paper. Also used colloquially to describe anything that causes little bits of happiness. A good relationship is often referred to as gifele.

touch-license; this is a concept that applies to the permissions granted to people who need it in order to fulfill their duties in a certain situation. So, a physician to treat a patient without asking if they can touch; a Guardian to train an apprentice by fighting; a tailor to measure a client; etc. In some cases, people still observe the form and make a quick ask: 'ijza'.
ear-fluff, ear-decorations, ear-prettiness. Anything that makes the ears more decorative, whether that's coloration, tufts, or even jewelry.
decorations on the end of a scroll rod/handle.
to grab food on the go, or eat quickly because you are between engagements.

a breakfast room, nook, counter, etc, in a house where you grab food. Does not usually have chairs; if it does, they are not comfortable "sit for a long time" chairs. Plural is "gishirash," and can also be applied to food carts or other temporary stands where someone can get quick food.
damaged flowers; flowers missing petals, or with bruised ones, or broken stamens, etc
contents; when used as a verb, means 'to make up the contents of' or 'to compose out of contents' or 'made up out of'
solar plexus--the area below the heart in the center of the body, roughly where the sternum ends--considered the seat of the will.
to ease a community back to normal after a disturbance

when someone's worldview has been tainted by knowledge they learned at the wrong time to properly assimilate it, and it colors their perceptions. A problem that requires Correction. (More or less 'ugly-leaning eyes')
spine. Has no singular, since a spine is made of many parts.
pejorative, slang: 'empty-head'. Not 'stupid', but someone who refuses to think things through. Singular 'haalebati'.
nothing, in the sense of 'emptiness where there should be something'
to be going in opposite directions
decorative cord, usually with tassels, used to accent clothes.
decorative cord used to roll up a sleeve; when used in second declension, refers to the object. When used in the first declension, refers to someone who eschews hard work.
decorative cord that accents the shoulder yoke and depends beneath the nape of the neck (where the main decorative element is intended to be seen from behind).
to grow (the passive sense: 'this thing is growing' not 'I am growing this thing')
to cry (with tears, or to cry out; this is considered louder/more violent than weeping)
head-blinded; used of someone in shock, or overcome, or dizzy, almost invariably for emotional reasons
on; is also used as slang for 'naturally' or 'of course'
to look (as 'to look into, or look at')
propriety; this is the propriety specifically of Kherishdar, which involves knowledge of the caste and rank relationships and the exceptions that rule them.

the doom feeling you get when you put something off, and the longer you put it off, the less you want to face it and handle it, and so you put it off some more and that only increases the feeling of doom and guilt
mail; also the verb, to mail
Qualities in spirit that differentiate castes. Singular is hefsheni.
chains, ropes, braids, things that are plied or interwoven.
bracelet, braided; a child's entertainment, often exchanged for friendship.
to get down to business, to take something seriously, to focus on it. Backformation from 'heketom', cords that bind back sleeves to keep them out of the way.
cords that bind a long sleeve back so it doesn't get in the way.
camaraderie, particularly among those in dangerous or difficult professions.
to reject, violently. Originally medical terminology, used to describe the body's violent expulsion of toxic/poisonous material.
it is from my perspective - the personal form of verijz, in which one is asserting something as a personal opinion. This form offers an additional perspective, and is not meant to invite argument.
to interview community members in order to derive a sense of the community's health

roots: from heth (to ask) and enil (to see obliquely)

Meaning: spice plant, rare and much prized, that must be found because it does not respond well to cultivation
needs that can only be met if they are not requested.

to need things that cannot be asked for; came about in a roundabout way, through observation of a rare spice plant that is hard to cultivate in a farmed context because it has so many paradoxical and difficult to predict or observe needs.
walls, interior (on a building not used by people for living spaces); literally 'not outside wall')
to divorce (to shatter a context). A violent form of parting that destroys the social context of the individual
jealous; unwilling or unable to share
the area beneath the jaw and above the neck; the underside of the jaw.
fevers (singular is irregular hhevrein). Can be conjugated to form a verb, though usually used in the passive
to express one's needs (possibly from 'explain,' bahhir', and 'needs', lif)
to grant; backformed from the older word 'hhivaeth'. The older, more proper form of the verb is 'hhithhir' which is seen in legal texts and old poetry.
to make as a response; to create a circuit
sun (modern/star). Distinct from archaic and now poetic tan.
leaf litter; also used to describe fur that looks dumb because you've slept on it and it's lying every which way.
"muscled". Having a layer of muscle under the fur/skin. Happens only through dedicated exercise and is typical only of Land-workers and Guardians.
plants that take over spaces and other plants. Verb form means to perniciously overgrow; sometimes used in medical field for diseases
to govern (as in oneself, one's emotions, one's actions). Not used for abstract/legal constructions
furniture (specifically, furniture that people use to make themselves comfortable, like chairs, beds, tables, etc. Furniture used to organize things or store goods or objects is a different word)
to find/plan mutliple routes to the same destination
to play-fight someone. Can be verbal or physical. Not the same as teasing, though play-fighting can be done as a form of teasing.
to unmake (in the sense of 'blight/destroy people's joy')
false testimony/witness, when given intentionally in order to harm/deflect blame.

destructive independence; in which a person believes they do not require or must not ask for the aid of others, or the connection of relationships, or love when in fact they do and must, and push all attempts of those who care about them away. This quality leads to akuvrash, the local destruction of an individual's community.
blinded, in the sense of believing oneself separated from the consequences of one's actions, and blind to one's needs
to instigate; has a far more negative connnotation in Ai-Naidari.
the failure that comes from attempting to make one's way alone in a situation or environment where one absolutely needs aid.
erase, elide, unmake, unsee, blot out

self-negation; the feeling that prompts a person to feel as if they don't deserve help or love, or that their existence is in some fashion a burden on those they care about. Considered a form of sickness.
"puts on bulk"; said of someone who easily gains weight (with no distinction between fat and muscle). Not a usual quality.
the person you think someone is when you're really seeing a reflection of yourself, or what you want/need in them.
balance between desire to lead and desire to follow. Every person's ieqera is different, leaning more towards one or the other, but every Ai-Naidari has both Qualities in them.
to withdraw from other people. a form of soul-sickness.
unfortunate situations caused by the friction between personalities that don't suit one another.
roads that lead away from cities/towns/center
to call attention to things that shouldn't be noticed.
someone who consistently dwells on things that should not be paid attention to.
to not ignore the things that should be ignored.

huh? (weak repair query). This word sometimes becomes (lazily) 'ee'. It's also the first declension ending for the 'possessed by' case and there's a sense that what you're possessed by when it's hanging out there without a noun is confusion.
fullness; also can be used as an adjective, full
"best when small"; used when something is best enjoyed at a small size, in moderation, in a small space, just small in general.
public censure; this leads to shame, which corrects improper/unwanted behavior, and is considered a social moral duty.
strong pavement. Terminology used in the game Rivers and Bridges.
music (the singular form of this noun refers specifically to a single person's repetoire/songs/way of humming or singing)
to fix (in the sense of 'fix a color' or 'cause to make permanent/set in place)

"from first principles," or "from scratch" or "from nothing" or "from a beginning with nothing" or "from conception". Describes making something from having nothing. (Usually used in logical arguments, but also used practically, like 'I made this dinner from scratch' where 'from scratch' entails 'I had to go buy all the ingredients because I didn't even have those.')
to see/apprehend the soul as a pattern that might have missing pieces; to see/notice unspoken needs
to virtue; to enact a virtue, to act in a way that makes that virtue manifest.
having an arabesque, curlicque, curved decorative swirl
an arabseque, curlique, curved decorative swirl
heart void; when something's been removed and needs refilling.
public demonstration of virtue; this is considered a form of example-setting and is one of the a social moral duties of all Ai-Naidar.
to taint something by believing something in advance of doing it
the ability to continue while suffering an excess of emotion; composure; equanimity (a little like)
to embody, to become flesh, to become part of existence
knowledge; the vast body of knowledge that exists outside yourself, as a resource in other people, which can only be accessed through other people.

appreciation of fullness of a thing's span, from its inception to its ending; implies that it is worthy at every moment of its existence, and acknowledges that it is different in the beginning from how it is at its peak and how it is at its end, and that this too is part of its worth.
perfect as it is', with the understanding that what is, is incomplete. Recognizes ishan in everything, and finds it beautiful

spirit; very specifically, your ishas is what defines your caste and rank no matter what caste and rank you're born to. This is your social identity (which for the Ai-Naidar is inextricable from your personality and who you are). On a very real level, you simply are your ishas.

the world's quality of being morally neutral. In basic, expresses that the world, fate, life neither leans toward evil and sorrow, nor toward happiness and good, but that the universe is a moral blank awaiting the influence of the Ai-Naidar.
"book-soul", a copy of a book used by calligraphers and illuminators to create new copies; it is simply the text, with annotations on traditional letter treatments and illuminations.
gift, specifically, one between friends (distinct from 'belevan', which is for intimates: lovers, beloveds, family).
to clear, or to make clear, a physical thing (as you would clear water by ridding it of impurities)
to know (a person, to grasp them as a whole, to see them clearly)
understanding (of a person, seeing them clearly, grasping them as a whole, getting them deeply)
clear; sometimes used as a name
clear; antiquated; has come to mean something like pellucid or limpid, clear with an emotional connotation of beauty
beauty (the artistic kind, created by people)
to refresh - literally, to smell flowers or natural scents, like ocean breezes, or petrichor
promise; also used as a name, particularly above the wall of birth
peace after Sorting through a huge emotional fight/problem
to fight with someone because of big, existing emotional problems.
to think/to ponder (not to any purpose)
to caress (suffixes are added after an added trailing t, like the noun)
caresses (the 't' also becomes the ending added to the verb when adding suffixes).

pioneering; said of people who have the ability to exist on the leading edge of society. Jenil people are often colonists, observers (scientists), engineers, or exist in any profession where individualism is useful.
dreams, fitful. The Sort of dreams one has while dozing, that leave one confused and disoriented when one wakes.
eggs (suitable for eating, or about to be used as food); singular is irregular jorvein
the plate you eat your portion of food off of.
psychological comfort; jzasu is a state of the soul or heart, and there is a connotation that it is reached by putting the heart at ease or peace. This is not an intellectual process.
witness - as in an account of something seen by a witness. This form of testimony is considered sacred. Also used as a person's name.
accepted; specifically, when one offers love, comfort or aid to another and is accepted. This includes an emotional feeling of pleasure on the part of both receiver and giver.
false testimony/witness - an account which is incorrect.
touch (not-specific, not necessarily Meaningful, accidental, pragmatic)
touch-permit; to allow to touch a certain area.
to receive something of intellectual, spiritual or emotional value (a gift).
worlds; singular version is irregular jzilni, not jzili.
recipients of a tangible gift (formed from jzirusir); orphans.
to receive something of tangible value (a gift).
scars (emotional only); this is a fairly modern word
door, cover; a door is considered a cover/obstruction over a path.
"where you left off". The place in a scroll where you stopped reading.
bookmarks. Literally "where you stopped reading in a book."
to know; this is knowing of a deep-seated, instinctual, gut-type feeling, acquired almost subconsciously.

describes a person who can be emotionally interchangeable with a large number of people in their relationships, so long as they are special to at least one person. This quality is known as darkaida in the noun form, which is a back-formation from the adjective.
to cut your losses; to stop the bleeding; to cauterize
to use emergency measures to re-establish a community after extreme distress
intimate activities that lead to the creation of family members (children or chosen-family). This form of intimate act is highly regulated by social rules and pressure.
to burn in order to prevent spread of disease, or to dispose of completely, or to excise
kindnesses (usually seen as singular, 'kindness'). This is a recent word.

intimate activities that have no effect on family matters: in other words, does not cause children or form bonds that must be recognized formally as part of family. This form of intimate act is considered a matter of personal choice and largely goes unremarked in Kherishdar

person who's into everything, trying to figure out how it works. This applies equally to children asking "Why" all the time and busybodies who want the latest gossip and elderly relatives who want to know if you really know what you're doing.
passion, zest, daring. An unusual form of esar, one that can become recklessness.

a type of 'keva', these are people who are constantly coming by to 'visit' but who are actually there to get the latest gossip. Can be affectionate (" can't wait for my gossip parnter to come so we can dish the dirt!") or negative ("they're always coming around to sniff for things that are going wrong and spread them around!") Singular is kevikevani.
tiny bells - tied to children to announce their movements
little happy things - small things (or acts) undertaken to bright a moment of happiness or cheer to one's life.
walls, interior, specific to places where people live

Archaic. "little sisters" From qirin, "sisters" and ki- (antiquated), "small; precious; to be protected; delicate." In modern use, a type of bird that, once it reaches adulthood, sings each day no matter its estate--even a dying kiqirin will sing--until it perishes. Though the Ai-Naidar do not keep pets, it is considered good fortune (and a pleasure) to have attracted the visitation of a kirqirin, which is usually found only in the small grasses of fields far from cities. From the word for this bird comes the interjection "ki-kiqirin," after the sound of its warm-up call; this is usually translated as "Sing while you yet live."
religion. Note: this word is neither singular nor plural. It cannot be made into a singular form because there are no "religions" there is only "religion."
nouns (when referring to people) Confusingly this word is also used for pronouns (referring to people). Singular is kirvi.
to fit, particularly by shaving/paring away
to tailor, to fit a piece of clothes to someone; does not refer to making a blank.

placed where one belongs; particularly, where a person's talents could fit anywhere, and were fitted somewhere there was a need. Derived from 'kishil', which can mean either to compose a piece of music, or to create something by choosing among many choices.
to compose a piece of music; also, to create something by choosing among many choices
to speak roughly, to disregard courtesy or kindness
to talk past someone because they are going in opposite directions

to speak one's responsibilities to one another; to communicate clearly expectations; to reaffirm the qet specific to a relationship. This unusual word was coined in a love poem to the harmony of a functional society and came into general usage.
to talk past someone because they are on different routes to the same destination
admission (as in 'admitting something', not as in 'giving someone entry')
atmosphere (science: gases, etc; this is the physical environment not made by people)
an argument involving abstractions, conducted logically; a debate.
to cheek-rub; a form of family affection
pastry, usually formed as a pocket but sometimes in a mold. Always hand-sized.
a covered dish used to hold a damp napkin
recipes - literally 'food parables'. Singular 'kulorani' is accented differently: 'koo loh RAH nee'
to fail to call attention to something that should be paid attention to.
to ignore something that should not be ignored.
"fortunately built." To be sexually attractive; to have a body with features that are considered advantageous in bedplay.
a truth you tell as an excuse or a deception (either to be polite, or to misdirect, or to give someone a way to save face)
to shift; also used by those above the Wall of Birth to describe someone whose ishas may be shifting/changing.
heads of household (can be male or female)
to err, to make mistakes, particularly silly or ridiculous ones. (To make serious errors is 'shauve')
shell, cocoon - anything something needs to break out of in order to grow that represents an in-between stage of growth.
to know via inspiration; to "get it."
loop, round--anything that connects with itself
theme; can be verbed, at which point it means 'to unify under a central idea'
to allow something unusual, because of trust/intimacy
to write/create. As in "to write stories," not as in "to write down on paper."
anger; what we would use as an adjective "I'm angry", for the Ai-Naidar is said "I have anger."

Pronunciation: [ LEHT aye DAH reh meh THEEL ],
Meaning: tea-plant symbiosis; the state of working with another to achieve a mutual success.
tea victory: a victory reached by compromise by the offended parties.
causes; when 'verbed' drops the a. (When declined for the noun, adds an 'l'
the success gained through working in conjunction with another.
complete usefulness; when every last particle of utility has been wrung from something.
to sigh; can be declined to form the noun; this is a positive sigh
a private garden or courtyard for the use of guests. Can be entirely enclosed or only partially. sing. leveri
to edge or embroider; declined, forms the noun
thousand; also, historically, the number of cuts due a slave who touched someone above the Wall of Birth (this was a death sentence)
to believe, to think, to have an opinion on
to etch, to burn; what acid does.
appropriate words; saying the right things at the right time; this is part of decorum
crack: this is both what pots do, and what clouds do to let sunlight through storms
alcove, small space; differs from pali in that livin can be closed off with expectation of privacy.
conversations. Can be literal or unspoken (as when there is banaj). Also, Guardian jargon for fights.
flowers designed by people; bred flowers
to know (by observation, or by consulting other people)
to carry/hold something that is needs to be contained
to fall in love: refers to any kind of initial, intense bonding period (whether touch-lovers, lovers, or friends, or crushing, or the love one might have for divine objects)
love, 'my love', as in the endearment
to eat with family, deliberately and patiently, as a way of coming together and sharing news/the day. This is a backformation from the word madrasarash, a word for a family's dining hall.
dining halls (singular: madrasarashi). The room in an Ai-Naidari family house large enough for the whole family to gather for meals.
token attached to children with information about their family and residence, in case they get lost. Literally "coming-home"

taint;  that which creates soul-sickness; a concept, an idea, a thought that, when contemplated, promotes alienation and twisted feelings; it inspires bad thoughts that themselves take root and become breeders of more soul-sickness.
to leash yourself to knowledge; to be led by an instinctive understanding to conclusions
to be good at following your instincts to the proper conclusion

knowledge; more properly, instinctual knowledge, or knowledge learned by immersion (as children learn initially, by being surrounded by others and absorbing their behavior, language, and contextual clues).
the kind of knowledge one can only absorb while free of excess stimulation.
liegelords/ladies, master/mistress - general term for anyone above the Wall of Birth.
duties a lord owes to those in his or her charge.
reverse-guided tour; in which the participants wander freely under the supervision of the guide, who then explains the points of interest they have found. (sing: maralevani)
to look outside, both literally and figuratively

to protect; note this word is related both to 'masuredi' (beloved master) and 'mazuked', the caste-rank that protects the lowest of the Ai-Naidar who are above the wall of birth. The mazuked were the original Guardians, and the caste expanded from their ranks. Note that this word is never used for non-people's acts.
master - this word has special connotations of intimacy and is not common. (Counterpart in the relationship is the menuredi; contrast with menedar, a regular kind of servant)
acts; declines irregularly as 'matemi' with an -m' because of root (temin)
ancestors; those of my bloodline who came before me.
a full landscape, a bounty, plentitude
suffering. In the sense of burdens.
a portmanteau of the word for veil-glow and the word for breathpause, shol.
flowers (in the home, already cut, being used for Ai-Naidari purposes)
duties one owes to one's liege-lord or lady.
servants (this is the non-intimate form of the word)
you're welcome (literally, 'we serve as a matter of course/forever/eternally')
loyal servants of a liegelord or liegelady; a special connotation of fidelity and intimacy. The liegelord/lady counterpart is masured(i). sing. menuredi
to force down from its natural state.

duty; in particular, one's duty to the easily overlooked, without whom one would never be what one is: family, society, those who came before you. The saying "standing on the shoulders of giants" is a perfect illustration of meqet.

cradle/embrace; this is an antique word, used mostly in romantic or spiritual poetry, or in ritual, and so rarely seen. Began as a word for holding someone tenderly; became the word for a literal cradle, and now is mostly seen as a prefix where it means 'resolved' or 'made better' or 'made safe'.

A ritual in which someone of lower caste-rank pledges fealty to one of higher, and both acknowledge their mutual duties, lord to vassal. During this ritual, the higher-ranked paints a ribbon pattern on the lower with a dye (or bleach). This dye fades over the course of a year, at which point the ritual is observed again. Only Thirukedi uses permanent dyes.
to replace, restore, return; also used for the act of closing a door
to submit; a virtue. Everyone submits to someone or something in Kherishdar, and to do so with grace is admired.
tether (used only for things on land)
best when large; used when something is best enjoyed at a large size, exuberantly or in large amounts, in a large space, just large in general.

body-modesty (this is the word we think of as 'body-shy', being nervous about people looking at us); not to be confused with metmisath which is often health-related, as in the way a person with an injury might flinch to be touched)
body-shyness - has connotation of delicate health as reason for modesty
To deal with a crisis and then have any necessary emotional collapse to wait before reacting.
furniture (but not people furniture, furniture that exists for objects, like shelves or cabinets)
to throw (like a ball, or an object)
empathy; 'to throw your listening (into another person's head, maybe).'
light (as in weight, the opposite of heavy)
shy; originally meant 'delicate' (in the health sense), but shifted in Meaning sometime after the unification.
frailty after illness; the recuperation period immediately after a difficult sickness or fever in which the patient is still weak and prone to relapse.

to interpret, to translate; since the Ai-Naidar no longer have multiple languages, this word is used in the context of a third party trying to help two people who are having communication issues to understand one another. Used later, occasionally, by Ai-Naidari who also need to make sense of alien languages.
new flowers; flowers that are just beginning to blossom
dictionaries (a "complete word book", using the idiomatic use of the number 10, 'mi', to mean 'complete')
to set down, inscribe, capture in time
look into, investigate, dig down into; can be literal or figurative
storm, particularly a small, local one that is violent but gone quickly
world-travel sickness; any physical issue caused by the passage from one world to another, be it illness due to new bacteria, response to local flora/fauna or gravity/breathing/etc issues.
fairness; this is a word about emotions, not a word pertaining to law or situations

fair (only applied to things having to do with people; does not describe legal or commercial transactions. A person who is morinij, for instance, is kind even when they're angry about something different.)
sickness. This word has no numbered form; physicians use 'poq' for specifics. Is usually declined to form the adjective: "I have sickness."
a moment or time that changes a person indelibly, forever
for company'. Said of actions done in order to make guests more comfortable or welcome.
to seek advice without asking for it directly
"oops" or "whoops" but with a self-conscious 'I did that' twist. 'welp, that was a thing I did', more or less.
opal (the gemstone). Said 'nah de YAH', is a person's name
to complete (a person, with other people). Can also be used as an adjective. The noun form, 'nafeth', is translated better as 'completeness' rather than 'completion'.
completeness (speaking only of people, when they are socially 'full', filled in)
to put in order; not Sort, but Sorting where everything is placed where it needs to be
precedence; this is social precedence, not logical or numerical; also means 'birth order' for children
to comb fur, to put fur in order, to make the pelt presentable (does not apply to hair, this is specifically about pelt).
fur comb, fur brush, a tool used only on the pelt.
appropriate acts; part of decorum is knowing what to do.
need to lead, be in charge, take care of others, be aggressive, make decisions (one side of the scale of ieqera).
legally antiquated; used of customs, laws or traditions that are held over from earlier times and are not strictly consonant with existing custom.
related to you by being part of your chosen family/house
constellations (the people who are connected to a person)
influence; one's effect on others (conscious or not).
the ability of a community or group to pass on its values to new members; community 'stickiness'

emotional capacity; the individual ability to cope with, stretch, give or handle emotional situations, carrying with it the understanding that each person's is different. Emotional health is measured in a person's nalureth.
experience, the wisdom that comes from experience, actually living many years. This is almost never considered a quality of the young.
to editorialize, to narrate, to personally report (implies you are purposefully giving your unique take on it)
definite, clearly-defined, edges visible; can be literal or figurative
unknown (cannot be used in the 'it's not known' sense, only in the 'great unknown' sense)

to put yourself forward, particularly by overshadowing someone else; scientifically, 'to occlude'. Because of the latter Meaning, 'nasret nuli' is a solar eclipse, and 'nasret jzili' is a lunar eclipse.
a form of maien, but of actions, not of words: a set of actions or behaviors, which create soul-sickness; is assumed to have a smaller scope than ideas
"small drinks". Drinks that are consumed for taste, not nutrition, and come in limited servings.

to know better; this is a word with negative connotations, used as we might say 'you should have known better than to act that way' or 'act your age'. Also used as an exclamation: 'you should have behaved with more decorum', more or less
the unhappiness caused by disappointing one's parents, family or elders. Often considered the first moral feeling in children and the first sign of empathy.
to belittle, oppress; to 'put people in their place' the way we would say it.
belittlement, disparagement, oppression; what people in power used to do to those beneath them.
wild; particularly said of nature, power, beasts, etc. 'Qevaut' is the social form of 'wild' (barbaric)
Wall of Birth; the line separating those of Noble or Regal birth from those beneath it.
clothes; singular refers to one persons's clothes. (So, plural clothes, 'the clothes worn by the Guardians', whereas singular clothes, 'the clothes worn by that particular Guardian.')
to deceive, purposefully; to put on a different face for the specific purpose of misleading someone. Derived from lijzan, masks.
to starve from lack of emotional intimacy
divination game used to see which family members will teach which values or lessons to an unborn child, usually played with small strips of folded paper.

acts, in particular those that require physical rigor: not labor, but rigor, as in going without sleep, a great deal of travel, physical supervision of others, walking, moving or riding. This word does not refer to hobbies or things done for fun, only to duties, obligations, or work/job-related functions.
active duties; what is expected of adults in the prime of their lives.
shallow, blade-like spoons used for eating
spoon speak. The use of utensils to make commentary.
spoon courtesies (more or less). The warm fuzzies you’re given by someone who treated you well with spoon-speak.
beauty (spiritual, religious, used almost always in a literal sense)
exception; has unsavory connotations: ghost, demon, outside, unlike. Not quite alien, but contra-societal.
to be affected emotionally by physical issues, as when hunger makes someone angry or exhaustion makes them depressed
events of an unfortunate kind. Special in a bad way. Stronger than a mishap, less necessarily long-reaching than misfortunate
use, particularly continuous (said of favorite objects, or mechanisms that aren't expected to be shut off)
how now'. A greeting: combines 'hello' and 'welcome' and 'what's going on'

not very, or not predictably, or not often; can be used both as a word, prefix, or suffix, and when used adds uncertainty or infrequency to a word. When used alone, indicates uncertainty. Very probably a backformation from 'nimaich', 'unlikely', and even further from an old Ai-Naidari word, nimaith, which meant a promise made by someone who would have to strive to fulfill it, and would probably fail.
promise, extraordinary and unlikely to be fulfilled because of its speaker's circumstances, or the promise's strenuousness
to scorn (this word began as the verb form of 'ridicule', 'nirot', but when the latter was verbed this word came to have a stronger negative connotation)
perfect (particularly said of things that are complete)
"there are no discarded Ai-Naidar" (one word to mean this whole phrase)
nothing, in the sense that 'everything has been destroyed, void, wasted, null.'
serious (as in when a person is).
serious (as in, when a situation is).
concerns; when conjugated, forms the verb 'to cause concern in others'

touch-points: these are specific zones or parts of the body that require specific permission (either under caste law or by individual permission) to be touched, and include points such as the nape of the neck, the face and the spine. (singular: nozjeli)
target (in Guardian slang, also 'point' as in 'you scored one'). This word came before 'nojzel'.
to try/test. Originally what a blacksmith did to swords to see if they were properly tempered. For Guardians, means to test someone's mettle in a bout.
injuries; can be conjugated to form 'to injure'; never used for emotional injury, only physical
to eat methodically, for fuel (with or without company).
weird, absurd, strange or unexpected, usually in a funny way.

funny story/stories (this word has no numbered form). An anecdote where the humor derives from something odd, absurd, strange or unexpected. This is the kind of story that you might start by saying, "So I was walking to work and the funniest thing happened to me..."

a person to whom strange, absurd or unexpected things are always happening. This person usually has an endless supply of funny stories to tell, most of them starting, "So I was just on my way to [do something normal] when..."
to value, to appreciate (this is the word most often used in translation for 'love' when speaking of an object)
to like (when applied to an object). Less extreme an emotion than 'noshiv'.
ball game that involves balancing a ball on your body while you roll it around; used to improve coordination, spatial skills, and hand-eye skills
catch (as in the game, to throw balls to one another for pleasure)
craft (a craft, as in "I have a craft") Plural of this one is irregular
to handmake, handmade (can be nouned). Literally 'meditate-craft'.
an improper mix of people in a community
nineteen (also the word for 'not quite complete')
a gratefulness that comes only from having a poison drained from one's spirit, a gratitude known most frequently from Correction.
weeks; an Ai-Naidari week tracks the period of the moon phase (full to gibbous to half to crescent). This word was almost certainly formed from 'nul' (moon) and 'audar' (face).
white, the pale blue-ish white like moonlight.
"padded". Having a layer of fat between fur/skin and your inner parts. A good thing: cushions against injury, makes a person more huggable/pleasant to touch.
a blank. Used by tailors for partially completed clothing left ready to be tailored to an individual, and for pieces of paper, etc.
to make a tailoring blank; to sew a piece of clothing to the point of basting/near-completion
loneliness, emptiness, grief; the emotion of being separated from everything that matters.
pitful: inspiring pity (possessing the quality of being piteous)
compassionate, full of pity for something, a tender feeling
evidence of/existence/visible/tangible. Not entirely sure of the partOfspeech.
to wander, particularly to do so in order to clear one's head
rifles, any long-barreled gun. Singular, ojuni.
best', in the sense of 'best for a situation' or 'best outcome'; it's specific to 'in a situation with an alternative, this is the option you want'
to run away, to flee (from things that are dangerous and should be fled from)
building of logical proofs, construction of arguments
argument (as in logical proofs). Also used alone as a synonym for 'point' the way we would say 'you have a good point.'
scars (physical only) (this is an old word)
to harm others even though you know it will hurt yourself
harmful to others and to yourself
Relieving-room; restroom; contains toilet and sink for washing.
stick figures. Very simplistic/stylized art depicting people.
stick figure humor. An art form that uses stick figures in sequence (or single panels) to depict humorous situations. Sometimes abbreviated to "onini."
starvation from the lack of emotional intimacy
to light, to set on fire
to prefer to be left alone, to push other people out until you yourself are ostracized because you no longer remember how to be social, or can no longer stand other people.
evening; dusk; also a color, lilac or pale blue-purple
parable/teaching stories (singular is orani). Can be formally known as an ora ekain, but rarely said that way.
to temper (as in metal, not food)
nothing (as for comparisons, or from beginnings/inceptions when there is nothing yet)
dried flowers; also the word for nostalgia

minister; highest rank in Public Servant caste, with few members. Osulked serve Thirukedi (the Emperor) directly, but this is not their distinguishing characteristic, as all Ai-Naidar may be called to serve Him. Osulked are known by their service to anyone in the Empire who asks, no matter their rank or their location. They are often sent by Thirukedi to different communities to offer their services, if it is perceived those communities need special aid.
mirror; formed after the fact from 'sontera', puddles, because you can see your face in a puddle

to sketch (derived from 'oteshav', originally meant 'to draw with wax crayon'; became associated with sketching because such crayons were originally used to brainstorm ideas, particularly for architecture).

crayons, wax; originally available only in yellow from the most basic/oldest pigment historically used (a yellow ochre derived from clay), these were made by combining pigment with wax to make a yellow crayon. Now refers to any wax crayon of any color, but still referred to as the blended word 'wax yellow'.
adaptable, comfortable with abrupt change, able to handle quick environmental shifts
unavailable, unconscious. Said of someone who is not available because they are asleep, unconscious or fainted.
state (only refers to an individual's state).
the receptive and restful mental state brought about by turning off the lights and accepting the cessation of activity.
emotional balance, in the sense of feeling that you have contributed as much as you are receiving (from life, people, society, etc). Sometimes related to justice or fairness.

the ability to handle the unexpected with grace, composure, and competence; from 'pad' (state of mind/being) and 'eshan' (flowing water); this quality is considered a form of esar when applied to leaders.
soul sicknesses of all types. This word has no numbered form.
cheer--the state of being able to always find things to be happy about. Also, 'shine' or glaze or gloss.

bring into malleable-space; the people allowed to do this are rare, and this almost always refers to the part of Correction that involves easing a person into a state receptive to being Corrected and it requires the facilitation and guidance of someone else.
to be reminded of one's natural state (this is cause for relief and comfort, and implies that you are grateful for the reminder).
when an inevitability comes into life, brought there by changes your spirit requires to grow.
night, solar. Distinct based on world and season.
trial-period; can be any length of time, but is common enough in many Ai-Naidari relationships and customs to have its own word.
available (conscious). Said of a person when they are awake and available.
done-and-finished, all done, realized, when speaking of a project, idea, or (particularly) book one is filling.
written at the end of a book you've come to an abrupt end to while filling (like journals), a kind of jokey interjection: "book done!" Has come to imply 'I ran out of room.'
to stroll, to walk for pleasure

trial-married; among Ai-Naidar it is common for there to be three stages of marriage: betrothed, where two are promised to one another; a trial marriage, which lasts anywhere from one month to several years, during which the two decide whether they are suited; and finally married until death's parting. Trial-marriages are more common among arranged pairings; during a trial, no children are begotten. A trial-marriage may be broken at any time by one of the parties with no shame.
sidewalk, walkway; used to be literal, and is now figurative or poetic. Has Meaning like 'journey' but more pastoral/routine.
to allow what must be, to be; to acquiesce without rancor, resentment or struggle. Often mistakenly translated by aliens with an implication of victimhood.
to cope (has connotation of 'sequestering oneself until one can deal again')
here (in this room). This connotation of here is very specifically within eye- and ear-shot.

fish (in the sea; alive; if you want to refer to a single living fish, you need to say 'one fish' or 'the fish'). Singular, piki, refers only to dead fish being consumed as food. There is no verb 'to fish'. You 'gather' fish. (not 'hunt', but gather.)
diseases, malady; includes both things we'd call a disease, and things we'd call injuries; anything that troubles or disturbs the physical integrity of a person.
armor (in the modern sense, of being created from modern materials to resist normal problems). Firefighting gear would be poreil.
to share (experiences and opinions and mindsets)
to clean (a non-person: so, a house, a place, an animal, etc). Interestingly, this word does not apply to holy places, which are 'made pure'
to adjust emotionally or socially (a small adjustment, as when you suggest something to someone in the hopes they will dwell on it and maybe decide to change)
social balance. Having enough of one kind of person, or several kinds of people, or ideals, in order to have a harmonous society.
good because it makes sense/has harmony/is all of one piece
wellbeing of a community, point of health and stability
transmission of psychologies through generations, (like a geneline or a bloodline, but for psychologies)
crucible, has the sense of it being inflicted by other people.
to toughen, to temper to the point of breaking
knowledge gained from the comparison of more than one point of view
to grasp, to apprehend, to see a pattern.

the ability to see abstract patterns as a whole and see how they apply to smaller systems. (Seeing the forest as well as the trees.) From 'qare' (to grasp a pattern) and 'elet' (eyes). In leaders, considered a form of esar.
to observe a community to see how it operates without direct supervision
to reject a new element of society that cannot be made harmonious. Also used when the body rejects a foreign object (slowly--not the sudden vomiting sense of ehenej )

to settle (in particular, to process one's experiences or to work through one's emotions or ideas until one comes to equilibrium); originally applied to people, but now is used in science circles to mean 'to precipitate' as in a solution (not as in rain)
to slay a person's body, to kill

day, Ai-Naidari. Separate from the concept of the solar day, brol. Different worlds (and even different seasons) might have different brol, but the qeli is the same from world to world and season to season.

hours; probably from 'qel' (day) and 'gar' (bit or piece). The Ai-Naidari hour is a fairly recent invention, and even now isn't well-defined; people are more likely to keep time by the bell tower period rather than the actual counted hour.
to feel (emotional things, not tactile things)
feelings, emotions; (not literal/tactile, but mental feelings)
lust-worthy--has become slang for someone being attractive, particularly in a way that inspires fantasizing.
a seeking-journey (undertaken on purpose, in search of insight; does not have to be spiritual, might also be solution to more common problems).
to allow to lapse into its natural state.

quality of solving problems by applying pure effort at them. This is a quality considered the realm of adults in the prime of their power, and refers to those times when something seems completely insolvable until someone just keeps at it long enough and it seems to "give in" to the willpower of the person trying to solve it.
to dwell in with your eyes'. To concentrate on something by letting your eyes rest on it.
to dwell in the future; can be both good and bad, depending on how it affects someone

mountain range, wall of mountains. Has come to mean a barrier, one that people no longer notice or consider crossing. Singular qerevani does not mean "one mountain," but rather "part of a mountainous wall."
all that is worth knowing/encompassing (deprecated; exists now only as part of the word for the Ai-Naidari empire, "Kherishdar," a compound formed from root qerish and udar, society or nation).

responsibility-defenselessness; quality describing the social duty one one has to another person based on your responsibility to them and how defenseless they are. To an adult, a child will have more qet than another adult. Most qet is relative based on caste and rank, but some qet is absolute (children and self, for instance).

acts, in particular those that involve advising, guidance, negotiation, thinking, refereeing; anything where the activity involves mental rigor, observation or language skills. Does not apply to hobbies or for-fun acts, only to acts that are obligations, duties or job/work-related.
wisdom duties; the work expected of elders as they "retire" from more active physical duties.

rainbows; singular is 'qetsorein'. A short form of the original word, qonret tsore, 'colored banners', which were said to be a sign from the gods that the fighting should/would end (in wars). Modern Ai-Naidar tend to think the word comes from 'qet' + 'tsore', which it doesn't, but it's still a pretty idea.
barbaric/wild/savage - specifically, when someone does not trust civilization

to shape something so that it becomes more that thing you intend (in the sense that a potter would shape clay). Sometimes also used for 'to grow' in contexts where growing requires the thing being grown to be changed, rather than just protected/given what it needs
time period; used for the blocks of time marked by the bells in cities. Literally 'time brick.'
to betray the trust of society by abusing its rules in order to destroy others. To hold oneself above the law. (noun) a gut wound.
modal pronoun - a command, reversed ('don't do the following'!).
the ability to see unrealized needs/problems/gaps
to spot problems/gaps/unrealized needs; also refers to the ability to work puzzles
(deprecated) banners that flew from settlements in order to indicate their status.
(deprecated) war banners; singular is qonreti avjzani

Modern usage is 'warning signs', as in those given off by people under stress that they're at the end of their rope. Original Meaning: 'distress banners', flown from settlements that were having problems they wanted help with from outsiders. Modern use is spelled with the 'k' consonant, not the q. Singular is qonreti qabeni, though rarely used in modern parlance.
banners indicating celebration. Singular is qonreti tsibili. (deprecated)
that, as in 'that thing I just referenced' (a statement/argument/situation that's just been stated and is now being referred to as the end of an argument)
flowers that grow in impossible places or conditions; modern singular is 'qorlithi' but antique is irregular qorlithein, which is also used as a (unisex) name
anthithesis; opposite; antagonist; now part of logic (possibly an intersection of 'qo' and 'iot').
demon; literally 'thing that un-names'. Still used literally, as either a profanity, or as a superstitious warning. ("Don't say that, a demon might hear you.")
false witness; this word refers to the person who gives false witness. The account, which is false, is under jzeniveq.
demon; literally 'thing that un-knows'. Once literal, now used colloquially to describe the voice that urges you to do bad things.
kiss - this rare uninfected form of 'kiss' is usually heard only when the speaker is unsure what kind of kiss someone's talking about, or as a 'ancient history courtly love' reference.
the calm you show people when you're not feeling calm on the outside.
edged or embroidered in metallic thread (assumed to be silver). If the embroidery is gold, it's usually a phrase (tish quleviq, or quleviq tishel)
here; a virtual or abstract space. This word does not refer to a physical location, but a non-physical proximity.
here (in the same general vicinity); this might be outside of a room or outside of immediate view, but definitely within a city.
satellite families (families that are related to you off your main tree)
to be just or morally strong when injured (see: ashquvil)
