age (in the sense of 'old'; 'age' as in 'how old are you' is a different word).

to fill with time. Not 'to age', but a description of age. If someone asked how old you were, you would use 'raelijz' and the number: "I (filled) (number)'. Note this is an active verb, not a passive.
acquaintance, also a verb, 'to meet, to make the acquaintance of)
helpless, but in this case, literally: 'not helped'. Like abandoned, but more specifically social, as in 'their peers and family didn't support them.'
to appreciate in value; also, to develop
to welcome; importantly, not used in the English manner of 'you're welcome' (a response to thank you).
when a person's ishas does not match his hhaza, his social position. A very rare occasion.
to guide, or train (used for both people and flowers, but not for animals)

guided choice; a choice that has been designed to have few options, to reduce the stress of narrowing down which decision you want to make. (Frequently used as a reminder to people who are flailing because they have too much to do: 'narrow your choices, and then make them.')
the fighting mind, the aggressive spirit reined by a disciplined mind. Guardian jargon.

small local places. Usually translated as "room" but not correctly; a rash is any small place local to where you currently are in space. So if you are in a house, a rash is a room (but could be a garden). If you are out, a rash could be a fountain, or an alley, etc.
sound (as in good condition, robust, etc). This is said not of people, but of objects; but strangely, also, of people's bodies. (Not of their spirits.)
proper, romantically; the way you want to do things for a beloved/lover to honor/pamper them.

consumption; once the noun form of 'rehhar', to consume, and fell out of use, replaced by modern 'rehharen'. This noun now is found mostly in poetry, or in allusions to a metaphysical or metaphorical consumption, and can be translated either as consummation or dissipation depending on the context.

city walls; these are the walls that separate districts of the city from one another so that the Nobles and Regals who administrate them know the boundaries of their responsibilities. They are invariably low, usually hip-height: low enough for adults to easily converse, high enough to keep small children from wandering.

a Correction; specifically used in instances where somone has transgressed against the rules of society and must be reminded how they are to act. Correction is not punishment, but an attempt to bring a person back in harmony with their ishas.
Correction stories; using words or scenarios to Correct.
to relieve oneself; this refers to any bodily need from hunger and thirst, to passing waste, to sexual requirement.
place to relieve oneself. Usually has a toilet and a sink.
to make more perfect, particularly in small/fiddly ways; to tweak
gods; this word has no singular form. 'one god' or 'a god' is formed with leading words ('the' 'one' 'a') or implied by the verb.
to wander in order to work out new ideas and get inspired for new thoughts
to wander/walk with someone else in order to work out thoughts together
to labor by choice (when there's an easier/more convenient/more modern way to do something, but you do it the time-consuming way because you want to)
armor (padded armor, worn by Guardians only).
to gather (specifically, in order to consume/eat).

robe that goes between the top layer of clothes (which are public-okay) and the external layer of clothes. Only used for Noble and Regal garments, because they're the only ones who wear that many layers anymore. No one's sure if this word came first, or rot (as in lids), but they appear to be related.
breath shared between people, "the living air".
interruption between people; when someone tries to insert themselves into another relationship; interloping
proper guilt, felt at wrongdoing for which one is judged responsible.
bridges; anything that bridges or covers a gap, used lyrically or emotionally to evoke imagery or a feeling of bridging something.

reparations; separation from Correction, rulesh are intended to comfort or repair the breach between two people as a result of an error, and are often levied in addition to Correction. (singular: ruleshi)
to give something of tangible value (as opposed to giving something of emotional/spiritual/intellectual value).
to recuperate; declining forms the noun
comfort (this word can apply to emotional or physical comfort)
to gesture, a gesture (from hand + dance )
the vulnerable side of the hand. Can be taken to mean the palm, but is closer to a legal term that encompasses the bottoms of the fingers and wrist.
bare hands; means, idiomatically, hard work (because hands are bared when sleeves are rolled out of the way to do work).
one handed; idiomatically means to do a bad job of something, a half-hearted or for-show job: you are only rolling the sleeve up on one hand.
aloneness in a crowd. Considered a pleasing thing; describes the sense of calm and comfort one derives from being out among people, but not engaging with them actively. "know you are not alone"ness.
favors promised to balance a small trouble or debt: the word is often extended to refer to the token used to denote that favor; righting imbalances in the social give-and-take is part of hasmera.
finest hidden - a shortening of the concept sathsiril

finest hidden - the concept that what is best and most valuable should be devoted to service, no matter how difficult and base that service; after the fine silk pieces basted onto the bottom of robes to keep them from being sullied
peace (the cessation of war / physical conflict )
to understand (to clarify); formed form 'to listen' and 'to know by examining multiple perspectives'
to (used rather, usually to form a verb infinitive)

listen; in particular, to listen closely to another in order to connect with them and truly learn and understand their desires, needs, challenges and problems. Considered the foundation of personal relationships and society at large, this skill is so important that to be without it is to be less than a person.
to write (as in "to write down, using letters").
"scribing finger" - refers to the blot of ink that gets ground into the finger under the pen of a scribe, and has come to mean "dedication to one's duties"
writing (as in physical, the product of writing letters; cannot be used to mean story)
it/them - archaic. Once used interchangeably for both objects and people in the umudked caste.
light, has come to mean "natural light" (instead of artificial).
podium, pedestal, narrow standing desk; a piece of personal furniture for writing
between; when used as a noun, speaks of a space or time between two states
gate. Particularly, 'gate for which you need a key or permission to enter.' (Also used as a name).

heart-gates; the concept that there are levels of trust through which people must progress in order to be close to another person. Different people have different numbers or levels of heart-gates; some people might have one (and let all Sorts of people close, trusting) and some people might be very reserved/guarded.
cuddly, liking to touch and be held
to enfold in silk; began as a literal word, now means to give responsibility to (because layers of silk are most commonly worn by those above the Wall of Birth)
to err (shamefully); suggests that the error has some kind of social or moral stigma attached.
"fortunately shaped." To have a pleasing set of features, or a body of unusual symmetry/standard beauty. To have a beautiful body.
space between two people - this is about the potential between them for choices and a relationship, and the freedom to move closer or move away.
A blossom that falls of its own accord. Also, a fortuitous thing.
dressing rooms. From shedre, "to dress" and "rash," small local place.
poetry (the singular form of this, shaeilsani, refers to a verse)
lovers (somone you are having sex with)
spiritual love, love of priests, devotion
the hollowed-out/queasy feeling of a relationship that has just gone through a big fight.
a hypothetical situation built on arguments constructed by reason; thought exercise.

to cuff; to discipline. In its original Meaning, referred to literal corporal punishment, usually smacking the face or the back of the shoulder, though it was used only for warnings or light disciplinary action. Currently is used almost entirely to refer to verbal discipline.
maiden. Also "The Maiden," as in kirana, Ai-Naidari religion.
to push out; to ostracize; to cause others to be lost/lose their bearings. A form of cruelty. Punishable by Correction.
to hold (not said of objects, but of people, or of duties/ideals)
usual, normal, everyday (good connotation, feels harmonious)
reck this! Formed from 'she' (command) and uvesh, which is probably the ending of a word that no longer exists.

decorum; specifically, knowing when to ignore things that should be ignored, when not to call attention to things that shouldn't be called attention to, and when to pay attention to and call attention to necessary things.
children, progeny; those who come after me.

trust; specifically the trust that develops when those beneath you are good followers, when they are not afraid to speak for themselves and know they will be respected. When you know they will not betray you.

motion; almost always used for emotional/spiritual motion, in the sense of a person changing or growing. This is usually considered an awkward, uncomfortable or painful process, but also ultimately an joyful one. Also used to describe a visual trope, in that the character/person in an illustration with the most motion is the one that is changing the most. This is often depicted as external motion (wind in hair or clothes) even if the character is not moving, as a symbol that they can't stop growing/changing even when they seem physically still.

full of motion; almost always used for emotional/spiritual motion, in the sense of a person changing or growing. This is usually considered an awkward, uncomfortable or painful process, but also ultimately an joyful one. Also used to describe a visual trope, in that the character/person in an illustration with the most motion is the one that is changing the most. This is often depicted as external motion (wind in hair or clothes) even if the character is not moving, as a symbol that they can't stop growing/changing even when they seem physically still.
soul-complement; someone who is shadow to your light/vice versa; someone who is so complementary to you that you compensate one another's weaknesses
to eye-skip, to not concentrate on something, to not focus because your gaze is wandering from this thing to the next.
to take care of; to parent; to mother. Most often used in a parental context, but not limited to that relationship.
brooding, (can also be verbed to derive 'to brood, or to ruminate')
to part, to be separated from.
symmetry, particularly emotional or social symmetry

people's emotional tolerance for interchangeability. A person with high shorevein doesn't mind if they're not the most important person in people's lives. Someone with a low shorevein needs to feel special to more people.
play (usually associated with children, not adults; there is a separate word for 'goofing off' that only applies to adults)
change, personal change; the kind of interior epiphany or decision or revelation that changes a life.
to be, to exist. (More literally: to have (by receiving or being given it, in a way that suggests divine externality) – so, say, duty and caste are things you receive this way.)
to have (by intrinsic quality) – so, say, you were born pretty or smart
to have or be by affliction (as in disease or misfortune)
someone so arrogant they're completely sure they'll always hit what they aim to urinate on. Slang and rude male vocabulary.
to explore, to palpate, to touch carefully in order to evaluate

This is a concept word and roughly means "to focus on one's needs is to be led astray" or "the needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few" or "it is important to put others first". Accepting this is the prerequisite for maturity because without it, there is no reason for people to uphold society/civilization.
braids; specifically those a noble or regal wears, particularly in front of their faces. Singular is sordehhani.
forest; singular 'sorevein' is tree, and 'sorevi' (modern) is 'separate small group of trees'
jokes that don't make sense when repeated (the 'you had to have been there' feeling)
patience (to say 'be patient,' you repeat 'sosho, sosho')
gemmed weights (as in those hanging from tassels on the end of scroll handles).
pointers/placeholders, weight. Originally used for a long narrow weighted rod for holding down scrolls.
agreed, or 'yes' or 'what you said': an interjection used for consensus/agreement
nourishing. Can be said of food or relationships, etc.
unsanctified; can be used in the literal sense, religiously, but more commonly used in modern language figuratively to denote a state of reception, particularly when awaiting a blessing or a purpose
blade; an archaic word that refers only to weapons. Now used almost exclusively by poets or Guardians or historians. Also, a first name
spackle; a quick solution meant only to tide over until a real solution can be implemented
great - in a less enthusiastic, more formal way. 'tadi' was formed by cropping this word.
hey' (often used as a stand-in for 'how are you'/greetings among peers)
to horrify (used for social or existential fears)

A state of being outside society, to exist outside the system; to refuse civilization and your ishas and to attempt to be separate from all other Ai-Naidar. To be free, when freedom is isolation, loneliness and Meaninglessness. To be unnamed. To not fit. A heinous, horrible thing.
emotionally disabled or incompetent; to be in a state where one is incapable of fulfilling one's duties or responsibilities or courtesies, or the ability to do so is impaired.
horror (used for social or existential fears)
to hear, or to listen to sounds that are not made by people
sun; antiquated, now has literary/spiritual overtones.
meditation exercise in which one watches the sunrise or sunset and attempts to separate all the colors in the gradient in the sky. Teaches patience, and ishan.
shiny; can also refer to cities which are lights-free, (do not observemeleshol).
someone who always looks fabulous - is put together and gorgeous
smoothly pelted, so well groomed that your fur looks shiny or glossy
til days' endings'. Poorly translated as 'eternally' or 'forever', but more specifically from that point until the point you die.

to play (a game, or a sport); spelling suggests this is a modern word, and that organized sports used to be the province of Guardian caste alone and thus not play, but training, or contests. In previous ages, all play was assumed to be done by children, thus 'shuf'.
solar plexus shield; a piece of clothing worn by those above the Wall of Birth, a slightly curved, flattened pad just below the heart.
to shield (when a thing does this)

sleeve, decorative. This is a removable sleeve one slides over an existing sleeve. Originally used to protect the sleeve under it, taraitom became subject to decoration themselves, until now they're the ornamental thing and the sleeve under it usually plain.
to shield (only when a person does this)
gradient (often refers to emotional as well as physical gradients)

Once referred to things that were missing that prevented a plant from thriving (literally a 'hole' in their thriving). Has now come to mean, figuratively, any need that prevents someone from flourishing, but that isn't obvious or spoken.
"center of attention," "black hole of attention", what you say of someone who draws all focus in a room, conversation, family, whatever to them, for any reason.

relationship imbalance - when what one person is getting out of the relationship is different and greater than the other person, and they are not aware of it (being aware of it would allow them to decide if it was fulfilling an existing need sufficiently). This is an old word, and started as a child's game (where you would balance weights on either side of a fulcrum, like a seesaw). The game vanished, but the word remained and gained its relationship Meaning. Now it is a game again (this time for Nobles/Regals as a teaching game), and also a test of skill for Guardians, who do it on a person-sized fulcrum for fun and acrobatics practice. It still has the relationship Meaning.
ball game played with hoops, usually by attempting to throw a ball through a hoop sent rolling across the ground
futile, in an absurdist sense; this old word was coined in warring times to describe the act of attempting to destroy a Gate by lofting things at it.
to stun/ a stun (rarely used as a noun)
and; in relation to; this conjunction was borrowed from logic, and serves a stand-in for 'is' in statements where two things are being compared or referred to as a group.
generosity  (This word has no singular form.)
to have by making – so, something you have because you practice or create it
to have by earning – so, say, a level of skill or an award for valor
to have by being given it, in a normal interpersonal way – like a gift
the constellation of things that make a relationship distinct from another, and unique. It's made up of all the things that you share.
total; also verb, to sum up (but only for numbers; not a substitute for 'summarize')

to update, to make understandable/comprehensible, to modernize. Originally used for scholars rewriting texts in old versions of the language; now used to refer to anything that might need renovation in order to be functional.
the you that other people perceive (held to be a better measure of who you are than who you feel you are on the inside).
to critique with perspective, as in thautsevet

the act of pointing out a flaw in something, and then discussing its merits and purpose as a whole; this exercise is not intended to assuage the dismay of the recipient of the critique, but rather as an exercise that reminds the critiquer of the holistic view, and the reasons it's worth fixing.

and. Also used as an interjection, Meaning (loosely), "there's always something more/else (unknown)." So, equally used in exasperation (for instance, after a long day, having one more thing happen) and resignation, in acknowledgement of unspoken things that still exist.
to balance, socially; to seek an equilibrium between parties so that their responsibilities toward one another are properly weighted. Sometimes wrongly translated as 'to judge'.
tender (as in caring, loving; distinct from the tender of a wound or abrasion).
lighting; has come to mean 'bias' (positive or negative), in the sense of 'the cast of light you are seeing through'
golden hour, the time of day just before sunset when the light is warm and angled
favorably shown, shown to advantage; glowing with loveliness
to pass, particularly in a dance
month (lunar); literally 'the moon's passage' (as in a dance)
eclipse (the modern usage, outside scientific circles). From tivre, 'to pass in a dance', and 'shin', sky. 'The sky's quadrille.'
cloth/fabric; singular refers to a piece of fabric separated from a bolt; plural refers to bolts or unseparated cloth
tailors, seamstresses, people who make clothes out of fabric
apprentice, young person learning an art, 'kid'
buildings (this old word was preempted by gedrat and now refers specifically to building principally used for living in)
tools (noun is toreti). Actual, literal tools
present (as in 'here, accounted for, aware and able to respond)
broken pieces; shards; particularly, pieces of shattered glass through which one can see refractions.
to miss (something: a concept, a detail, a thing in the environment)
snows (singular is tovani and refers to clumps of snow, or discrete snowpiles/banks)
closer to divine; closer to center; focused on the right and high things
to raise or improve the emotional energy level of a gathering; to improve the tone/health of a group
heart-beat; a measure of subjective time.
fortitude; in particular, the kind of strength that leads to serenity, associated with the gut. An "iron stomach," in the sense of being strong-enough-minded that few things penetrate your peace.
well; a connotation that things are as they should be, or are in their ideal state.

done, forgotten, has been emotionally put in the past... what one says of something that one has made peace with, that it's "done" as far as you're concerned, done hurting or influencing or changing you. Can also be used as an interjection: Done! Gone! Done!
to make something be done, to put paid to it
peace/freedom; specifically, the feeling one has when responsibilities are properly distributed and people are not inappropriately burdened
uncanny; fey; touched - 'smoke sick,' (as in 'made crazy by the incense used to summon the dead')

to fulfill one's desires; can be positive, but is usually used when someone is finding pleasure without social function/Meaning. This ties into the Ai-Naidari concept that happiness is not found alone, in fulfillment of what one wants, but as part of a community, and that your happiness should be about what you find in that context.
knife; specifically a ritual knife (must be made by and consecrated by priests)
babies, infants (singular, tsifi, and 'qitsifi' is common: 'little baby')

small personal milestones. These are little goals you give yourself that you want to celebrate when you meet, but don't have a broader community impact. So, for instance 'get to the point where I can do 50 jumping jacks in a row' is a tsili, but 'have my first baby' isn't (because that's something everyone celebrates). Your friends might cheer you on if you share your tsil with them, but it's not a big deal except to you and anyone who wants you to succeed.
kit', the tools one needs to fulfill one's function in society (so, say, paint and paper if you are a calligrapher, needle and thread if you are a tailor, etc)

citations; used to be the proper noun form of 'tsolin' but once that verb was nouned by modern usage, 'tsolineth' came to mean specific mentions of individuals, and then, from there, a more formal literary Meaning.
robes (either for those below the Wall of Birth, or an intermediate layer on someone above the Wall of Birth, above the under-robe and below the coat/over-robes).
whisper hem - the cloth shield basted onto the bottom of floor-length robes to keep them from gathering dirt/getting grimy. Named for the sound they make when dragging.
to cite - backformed from modern use of tsolineth
roots; this word originally indicated "mother's side of the family" and later came to be used for literal roots.
great room, hanging-out place, den, etc.
a mental state that makes it impossible to work because of agitation or soul unwellness
to burn food. Colloquially used to express the concept that someone useful has been transformed to something completely useless.
friction; the kind of irritation caused by two people interacting whose personalities don’t mesh well. Never used for mechanical friction.
Correction/refinement of society, so that it includes only those Qualities, traditions, customs and laws that serve it.
prepared; said of people, particularly if they are habitually ready for anything. Note this word is not used for things that are prepared (like food)
wasted (as in thrown away, not as in bodily diminishment)
the concept that society/civilization requires refinement/paring away of things that no longer serve it.
the embarassment from having caused/being involved with a social bomb
quiet. Particularly, a quiet one cultivates in order to calm the spirit and silence the busy mind and its voices.
cream (as in the stuff you smooth onto something)
meals.Not the same as food ("kul"); ush are prepared foods meant to be consumed.
helpless (in the sense of weak and dependent)
to armor (a modern formation off the older word for armor, 'utesh')

armor (more formal/hardened than padded armor--this will have metal or lacquered wooden parts). This word is rarely used outside of ballads and older stories, and modern Guardians would not call modern armor 'utesh', only historical gear.
nouns (singular is 'utsi'). This refers only to nouns that aren't people
reserved, in terms of showing affection. The opposite of fashanil.
Correction when effected with actions, rather than words.
to wither, withering; to waste away. began as a noun, was verbed by modern Ai-Naidari. This word is only used for people (bodily and spiritually and emotionally) or for plants.
anyway - more or less 'walking back to centered'. Used only to return a conversation/arguement to its original topic
weak, in the sense of 'might explode or fail messily)
poorly maintained and likely to fail violently'. Said of someone who is vulnerable because their social connections are not of the right kind, or right amount.
to seek (originally, to take a journey by foot: to walk a great distance in search of something)

to stretch reality; roughly equivalent to lying, but with the connotation that in holding this belief, you are choosing to knowingly distort reality as you know it (this is different from unknowingly stretching reality, or denying it; vamsaun has a connotation of hoping to make something true just by deciding it will be).
to not call attention to something, which should not be called attention to.
originally "sleeping niche/room/alcove" but has come to be "place where someone sleeps", implying the bed itself.

to curse; originally meant 'to ostracize' and was used to cut off entire communities or families from trade/aid/roads/etc. Originally an act that could only be commanded by a religion, was later co-opted by ruling families.
messed up; usually refers to a community substantially crippled by missing connections or broken ones.
hell; a messed up state, communal
curses - a more modern word, formed off vashket

to correct; specifically used in instances where somone has transgressed against the rules of society and must be reminded how they are to act. Correction is not punishment, but an attempt to bring a person back in harmony with their ishas.
shoulders and upper chest. Includes the ribcage.
splash; once used only literally, has now come to mean the 'emotional splash' bystanders to an argument or intense moment between other people. Can be verbed.
objects of contemplation; a meditative aid. Can be anything, from a person to a vase. Something you fix your eye upon in order to calm yourself. Touchstone.
an empty vessel used as a meditation aid; popularized by a historical poem that spoke of filling an empty vase with one's spirit so one could contemplate it from a remove.
either an indefinite article when used with first declension nouns (people) or a definite one when used with second declension nouns (things that are not people). So 'veh' is both 'the' and 'a/an'.
to attend (a person), to wait on a person
weather (this is changeable weather, like storms or wind, not climate, like 'it's hot).
appropriate time - part of decorum/courtesy is knowing when to do or say things.
Leads a statement intended to be taken as a statement. 'There is' or 'It is'.
placed where one belongs, optimally; when a person is set somewhere they love their work, in specific.
notch between the collarbones (the hollow beneath the throat)
collarbones (singular: vetihholni). Or more literally 'the bones of the notch of your throat)
streets, roads (in a city or town)
to ignore something that should be ignored.
used to mean 'seed' (literal) but has become 'the things in you that you are unaware of that will become something else, good or bad'
it may be - the conditional form of verijz, this offers a hypothesis that may or may not be true. This form asks for argument/discussion.
said of a relationship: knowing someone well-enough to read their moods/behavior and compare it against what's normal for them.
to remove; also used for the act of opening a door
tools (noun is irregular 'votetil'). This word used to refer to actual tools, and now is used almost invariably metaphorically to refer to people.
catastrophic end/destruction/lack of because of destruction of civilization
attraction (a form of love, in this case, body-love)
appropriate knowledge; knowing what you should know, and no more, and no less, for contentment. This is part of decorum
rest  (people only, does not refer to 'resting something on a table')
to rest (people only, not objects or animals)
impressions others leave on us, when they've passed in and out of a person's life.
burdened, inappropriately; when someone is being used or leaned on unfairly, abusively, or in a way that drains them.

burdens, inappropriate. Singular of this word refers to the burdens applied to a person, or more than one person; the plural is used to indicate a state where the entire community is suffering from this error.
habits or traditions or laws that no longer serve civilization/society.
to pass one another on different routes to the same destination
to miss that someone is on the same path with you because you are in different places
robes, specifically, those for above the Wall of Birth
to skill up; to practice mindfully in order to become more skilled

horizon; also, a goal you are working toward but do not yet have the skill to accomplish. Interestingly, the science word uses -n to form the regular singular (yamerani, a horizon), but the goal word declines irregularly (yamerai)

knife rejection Being spurned in a very unmistakable way by someone’s table speech. (This is the harshest table-speech rejection you can get. Some people might tease: Are you sure it wasn’t a spoon rejection in response, for instance.)
paper. Plural unless it has been cut on purpose.
complex to remember, needing concentration and developed mental skills
reminders; particularly, things that bring back good or useful memories; souvenirs
shoulder yoke(s). The area of the body including the collarbones, shoulders, and below the nape of the neck. Singular is irregular yelmein (yehl MAYN).
saddle with; literally 'to shoulder yoke', after the harnesses put on beasts of burden.

a special thing you share with a particular person, and only that particular person, which is a major intimacy marker for that particular relationship. i.e. "you're the only one I talk about my fears about dying." "You're the only person who talks with me about this one hobby, and feels a strongly about it as I do."
to clean/groom/make presentable. (applies only to people.)
rope words', speech meant to strangle, belittle, constrict, or fetter people
the word for a thing/the name of an object (not the same as the name of a person, hun)
titles (not a person's title, but titles of things and works of art, etc)
suggestible (has fewer negative connotations in Ai-Naidari, and implies 'easy-going' rather than 'gullible').
confusion; specifically social, to be misunderstand one's responsibilities and privileges.

frail, bony, thin. Having no fat or muscle between your skin/fur and the interior of your body. Considered worrisome: makes one more prone to injury. Typical of the elderly, but some people are just born this way. (This not the same word as graceful.)
wordless noises people make (hums, purrs, interrogative sounds, etc). This applies only to sounds intended to communicate with other people

unmolded spirit; once meant 'secret heart', as in 'there are things about me that I never speak of!' and has come to mean the thoughts and desires that arise spontaneously, before mental discipline and common sense are applied to them.
to score; can be declined to form the noun
"bowl people" Someone you trust enough to share bowls with.
belt. This is a leather belt, or a thin corded belt, suited for tool use. This word never refers to decorative belts, no matter how thin they are.
abased (in the gradient of abased - neutral - implacable)
to run away (from things that may not deserve that reaction)
practical, down-to-earth person; literally 'ladle-finder', the person who makes sure you've set out all the silverware.
to call (in the sense of vocation)
weak, in the sense of lacking strength, unable to perform, likely to not make an impression, faint
poorly maintained and likely to fail (become depressed/suicidal)'. Said of someone who is vulnerable because their social connections are not of the right kind, or right amount.
dreams, restful. The dreams that make sense of the world and the day's events, from which one wakes feeling together, capable, and even inspired.
small room for meditation, usually containing a vauni haale.
